definitions.definition: To count ; to enumerate ; to number ; also, to compute ; to calculate .
To count as in a number, rank , or series ; to estimate by rank or quality ; to place by estimation ; to account ; to esteem ; to repute .
To charge , attribute , or adjudge to one, as having a certain quality or value .
To conclude, as by an enumeration and balancing of chances; hence, to think ; to suppose ; -- followed by an objective clause
examples: I reckon he won't try that again.
I’ve just heard from the repairman: it's going to cost £1000. I'd reckoned it’d be £500 at most.

definitions.definition: To reckon with something or somebody or not, i.e. to reckon without something or somebody: to take into account , deal with , consider or not, i.e. to misjudge , ignore , not take into account, not deal with, not consider or fail to consider; e.g. reckon without one's host
To make an enumeration or computation; to engage in numbering or computing.
To come to an accounting; to draw up or settle accounts ; to examine and strike the balance of debt and credit; to adjust relations of desert or penalty.

main_definition: To count ; to enumerate ; to number ; also, to compute ; to calculate .
secondary_definitions: To count as in a number, rank , or series ; to estimate by rank or quality ; to place by estimation ; to account ; to esteem ; to repute .
To charge , attribute , or adjudge to one, as having a certain quality or value .
( colloquial ) To conclude, as by an enumeration and balancing of chances; hence, to think ; to suppose ; -- followed by an objective clause

To reckon with something or somebody or not, i.e. to reckon without something or somebody: to take into account , deal with , consider or not, i.e. to misjudge , ignore , not take into account, not deal with, not consider or fail to consider; e.g. reckon without one's host
( intransitive ) To make an enumeration or computation; to engage in numbering or computing.
To come to an accounting; to draw up or settle accounts ; to examine and strike the balance of debt and credit; to adjust relations of desert or penalty.
